mdxNotes.title: Regex (Javascript & Typescript)
mdxNotes.content:
---
title: "Regex (Javascript & Typescript)"
created: 8-24-23
---


# RegEx notes and cheatsheet

* use a single `|` to say 'or'
* `[ ]` - says any of the characters inside the brackets
* `?` make the preceding token optional
* `.+` - matches all characters to the end of the line
* use parentheses to group characters as using the `|` alone divide the regex into only a left and right side.
* `^` matches only if it's at the beginning of a string
* `$` matches only if it's the end of a string
* `+` is greedy - it won't just get the next token. it will keep searching until it reaches the last one.
* `+?` is not greedy - it will just search to the next occurrence of a token.
* `{3}` - would match 3 occurrences of the preceding token
* `{3,4}` - could match the range of 3 to 4 characters of the preceding token

## Flags
* `\w` - matches any word character
* `\r` = carriage return
* `\n` = new lines
* `\s` = space characters
* `\w` = word character
* `\d` = digits 0-9

## Lookahead and Lookbehind
* `(?<!`  = negative look behind
* `(?<=`  = positive look behind
* `(?=`  = positive look ahead 
* `(?!`  = negative look ahead

## JavaScript Methods
* `RegExp.exec(string)` = Applies the RegExp to the given string, and returns the match information.
* `RegExp.test(string)` = Tests if the given string matches the Regexp, and returns true if matching, false if not.
* `String.match(pattern)` = Matches given string with the RegExp. With g flag returns an array containing the matches, without g flag returns just the first match or if no match is found returns null.
* `String.search(pattern)` = Matches RegExp with string and returns the index of the beginning of the match if found, -1 if not.
* `String.replace(pattern,string)` = Replaces matches with the given string, and returns the edited string.
* `String.split(pattern)` = Cuts a string into an array, making cuts at matches.
mdxNotes.formatted:
# RegEx notes and cheatsheet

* use a single `|` to say 'or'
* `[ ]` - says any of the characters inside the brackets
* `?` make the preceding token optional
* `.+` - matches all characters to the end of the line
* use parentheses to group characters as using the `|` alone divide the regex into only a left and right side.
* `^` matches only if it's at the beginning of a string
* `$` matches only if it's the end of a string
* `+` is greedy - it won't just get the next token. it will keep searching until it reaches the last one.
* `+?` is not greedy - it will just search to the next occurrence of a token.
* `{3}` - would match 3 occurrences of the preceding token
* `{3,4}` - could match the range of 3 to 4 characters of the preceding token

## Flags
* `\w` - matches any word character
* `\r` = carriage return
* `\n` = new lines
* `\s` = space characters
* `\w` = word character
* `\d` = digits 0-9

## Lookahead and Lookbehind
* `(?<!`  = negative look behind
* `(?<=`  = positive look behind
* `(?=`  = positive look ahead 
* `(?!`  = negative look ahead

## JavaScript Methods
* `RegExp.exec(string)` = Applies the RegExp to the given string, and returns the match information.
* `RegExp.test(string)` = Tests if the given string matches the Regexp, and returns true if matching, false if not.
* `String.match(pattern)` = Matches given string with the RegExp. With g flag returns an array containing the matches, without g flag returns just the first match or if no match is found returns null.
* `String.search(pattern)` = Matches RegExp with string and returns the index of the beginning of the match if found, -1 if not.
* `String.replace(pattern,string)` = Replaces matches with the given string, and returns the edited string.
* `String.split(pattern)` = Cuts a string into an array, making cuts at matches.

mdxNotes.title: Ulld App Config
mdxNotes.content:
---
title: Ulld App Config
created: 10-3-2023
---


# Ulld App Config Documentation


<Admonition title="Type" type="info" dropdown>
```ts
interface AppConfig {
preferFs: boolean
fsRoot: string
noteTypes: DocumentTypeConfig[]
bibPath: string
cslPath?: string
autoTag?: { path: RegExp, tag: string }[]
code: {
    theme: {
        light: string
        dark: string
    }
}
navigation: {
    navbarBreakpoint?: number
},
UI?: {
    table?: {
        maxHeight?: string
    }
}
database?: {
    /// storeFormatted: whether or not to store the formatted content along side the raw content. This will speed of load times but nearly double the size of each note in the database. Default: false
    storeFormatted?: boolean
    removeIfNotPresentInFs?: boolean
    ignoreFilepaths?: RegExp[]
}
latexPackages?: LatexPackageOptions[]
latexFontUrl?: string
notebooks?: {
    execute?: boolean
    environment?: string
    nbconvertPath?: string
    notebookOutputDir?: string
    nbconvertTemplate?: string
    // timeout of notebook conversion in **seconds**
    conversionTimeout?: number
}
plotColorList?: string[]
plotColorSelectionMethod?: "inOrder" | "random"
credentials?: {
    googleServiceAccountJsonPath?: string
}
}
```
</Admonition>


## Parsing Process
> This is purely informational so you can decide how to best use this app for yourself. Many options exist for flexibility, but the use cases for some are very narrow and likely won't apply to your setup. Overall, you should be just fine ignoring this section if you are using a mostly default `appConfig`.

[#ulldToDo]
- Write this section explaining the note-prisma relationship and setup /*
- Write explanation as to why there're two separate syntax highlighting variables. Mention that `pygmentize -L styles` can be used to find notebook styles.


## Config Setup

### `appconfig.preferFs`

Whether or not to always load from the file system. This can be turned on on a per-use case by appending the search parameter `?fs=true` to the end of any route that is displaying a markdown or mdx note. The per-use case is ***strongly*** recommended as the load times are dramatically improved when reading from the database.

Reading directly from the file system is not available for the following file types:

- `.ipynb` _By the nature of this file type, a editor such as VsCode or Jupyter lab should be used for interactive editing, and later consolidated with the rest of your notes via the [notebooks page](/notebooks)_




___

## Key Take-Aways
- [ ] Create page dedicated to a NoteType object in the `appConfig`. [#ulldToDo]
- Append `?fs=true` to the end of any url that is displaying a note to read directly from the file system. This is especially useful when viewing a note you are editing in real time. The page will still need to be refreshed between changes, but the file will not need to be sync'd with the database after each change... a simple `cmd-r` with the browser in focus should do.

--- title: Components and Props created: 10-1-2023 --- # ULLD Components and Properties ## Text ### Underline ```tsx
    Some content
```

### Highlight ```tsx Some content ``` Some content ### Small Text ```tsx Small text ``` Small text ```tsx Small text ``` Small text ___ ## Layout ### Admonition - info - bug - note - tip - faq - abstract - todo - success - warn - fail - example - quote - cite - equation - important - equation - plain ```tsx ``` ### Grid ```tsx ``` ### WithSidebar ```tsx

Some error content
Some tight error content
Some muted content
### Tagbar documentation docs Ulld Generally used at the top of a document to tag a note with tags that do not fit neatly within inline content. ```tsx A List of space seperated tags ``` ## Data & File Type Display ### Model View Renders a 3d `.gltf` or `.glb` file in an interactive container ```tsx ``` ### Latex Renders `.tex` content to an svg, so almost all `.tex` features are enabled. This should not be treated the same as latex math embedded in a `.md` or `.mdx` file, but rather as an actual latex document. ```tsx ``` ### Html ```tsx ``` ### Video ```tsx

Write an image from a base64 string format to the file system as an image.

equation.title: Centripital Force
equation.desc: Centripital Force where $T$ is the rotational period.

equation.title: Escape Velocity
equation.desc: Escape velocity where $M$ is the mass of the gravitating body.
equation.asPython:
def ve(m, r, G=spc.G):
    return np.sqrt(2 * G * m / r)

equation.title: Schwarzschild Radius
equation.asPython:
def rs(m, c=spc.c, G=spc.G):
    return 2 * G * m / c**2

equation.title: $\gamma$
equation.desc: Time dilation factor in the co-ordinate system $s$, and as proposed, the space divergence factor in the co-ordinate system $s^\prime$.
equation.asPython:
def gamma(v, c=spc.c):
    return 1 / np.sqrt(1 - v**2 / c**2)

equation.title: $\bar{\gamma}$
equation.desc: A local, physically equivalent $\gamma$ factor as it is applied to space, via a gravity model that where $g$ is secondary to a gravity produced via a divergent co-ordinate system.
equation.asPython:
def gammabar(g=spc.g, R=earth.radius_polar):
    return 1 + g / R

definitions.label: Calorie
definitions.content:
The amount of energy required to raise a gram of water by 1 degree celsius.  
1 calorie = 4.2 Joules

definitions.label: Conic Sections
definitions.content: The circle, ellipse, parabola and hyperbola are called _conic sections_ because each shape can be obtained when a plane intersects one or two right circular cones.

definitions.label: Dipole
definitions.content: An electromagnetic field defined by only two charges of equal magnitude but opposite polarity.

qaPairs.question:
# Find the derivative of the following
$$
\frac{d}{dz} \left(z + 2\right)\left(z + 4\right)^3
$$

# Find the derivative of $f(x)$
$$
f(x) = 3x^2 + x^{4.5}
$$

# Find the deriviative of $p(x)$
$$
p(t) = e^t t^\pi
$$

todos.task: Add state functionality to the different 'to-do' page menus.
Change todo 'status' row element to a dropdown button that onClick changes the status for that specific row.
Create to-do detail display with markdown 'detail' display and a modal to use as an ide like editor for editing larger markdown inputs to edit that field.
Add settings field that allows for the setting of daily or one-time reminders about tasks in your todo list. Eventually be able to add individual notfications and show them via browser alert.
Make dueDate row element clickable and expandable into a calendar component.
Make command palette flow to enable both viewing and adding of a to-do
Replace empty date row element with a small, muted 'add' button with a calendar component.
Add ability to add taggable felds to-do's, as well as a `<FullForm.../>{:tsx}` component for use filtering by existing tags (populate only with tags relevant to todos... not all tags)
Add drawer to lawyer_vid and review responsiveness throughout the entire app.

diets.name: Fasting Avoidance
diets.summary: A diet focused around fasting avoidance to address concentration, sleep and muscle twitching. Short duration cardio is allowed if properly fueled. Dietary staples should focus on low glycemic carbs with minimal gluten and not avoiding carb intake for more than 2.5-3 hours throughout the day.

healthReport.title: Decent but relying on a crutch.
healthReport.summary: Overall feeling fairly decent. My skin is dramatically improved from what it was ~5 days ago when my psoriasis_ was coming back on both temples, my eyebrows and around my nose. The psoriasis was minimal (3/10) but it hasn't creeped up at all in a while. I do however feel that a big part of the reason my racing thoughts and ADHD are under control at all is because of my weed consumption that began again on Christmas Eve.
healthReport.anxiety_desc: Average for me. Still super scattered and I've been relying on weed at night and sometimes during the day to regulate the racing thoughts, but even during sober periods when working I seem to be ok for a few hours until I get restless, which makes me concerned about how this will affect my abstinence from alcohol.
healthReport.mood_desc: Decent but probably because I've been smoking weed so much.

healthReport.title: Just ok
healthReport.summary: Feeling reasonably well. Started to have the urge to drink recently after quite a while and this is usually about the time that I would slip up, so let's not fuck this one up this time?
healthReport.anxiety_desc: Ok for a span of a few hours in the early-mid afternoon when the medication is at it's peak. Pretty shit elsewhere.
healthReport.mood_desc: ADHD and racing thoughts are creeping up again, but overall they're in check largely because I've been smoking weed again for the past month.
